Articles.Content:
Anyone know of any computers intended just for rovers? While normal computers will do the job, I was wanted to know if there were those who had additional SAS options that allowed for the rover to land on the ground (such as when it flips into the air due to low gravity) or compensate for reaction wheels (since those can alter the traction of the rover).

Nothing urgent, just would be convenient to have.

 

EDIT

Land on the ground, as in, wheels first, in a prepared position.

It's always going to land in the first place, regardless.

Edited July 28, 2016 by Core
